title: Teen shot himself in the foot in Town of Hartland
content:
TOWN OF HARTLAND – A 15-year-old was rushed by his mother to Medina Memorial Hospital on Sunday afternoon after he shot himself in the foot while target practicing at his home in the 9400 block of Townline Road.
The boy spoke to Niagara County sheriff’s deputies at the hospital and admitted he was “not practicing good gun safety.” He said he was in his yard target practicing at 2:40 p.m. Sunday. He walked up the target and had the gun pointing at his right foot. He said the gun accidentally discharged and a round from the Remington 870 shotgun hit his foot.
Medina Memorial Hospital staff confirmed has been shot in the right foot and the bullet struck between the third and fourth toe.
The 15-year-old was transported to Women and Children’s Hospital in Buffalo for further treatment, according to the sheriff department report.
